meanings.definition: The sound of a bell ringing.
meanings.sent1: I heard the dingdong of the bell from the church tower.
meanings.sent2: The dingdong of the doorbell signaled our guests' arrival.
meanings.sent3: The dingdong of the school bell marked the end of the day.
meanings.sent4: The dingdong of the wind chimes filled the garden with music.
meanings.sent5: The dingdong of the alarm clock woke me up in the morning.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a dingdong and listen to your teacher.
meanings.sent2: He always acts like a dingdong in front of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The comedian played the role of a dingdong in the movie.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dingdong after making that silly mistake.
meanings.sent5: The class clown was known for being a dingdong.

meanings.definition: To ring a bell loudly and repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: I will dingdong the bell to gather everyone for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to dingdong the doorbell when she arrives at a friend's house.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to dingdong the bell for fun.
meanings.sent4: The church bells dingdonged throughout the village on Sunday morning.
meanings.sent5: He dingdonged the bicycle bell to warn pedestrians on the path.
